name: balaban
definition: Balaban is cylindrical-bore, double-reed wind instrument, about 35 centimetres long, with eight finger holes and one thumb hole.
description:
Balaban is made of apricot tree, cane, barrow and cover. Its body has 8 holes on the surface and one on the back, in the middle .

Sometimes an additional hole is made on the lower end of the bottom side to ensure good timbre.

The upper end of the stem is given a round shape, whereas the lower end is sharpened.

Balaban, one of the ancient wind instruments, is played in all corners of Azerbaijan.

On solemn occasions such as weddings and holiday ceremonies, a balaban player is accompanied by a percussionist.

A traditional Azeri musical group consisting of two balaban players and a percussionist.

facts.name: Mouthpiece sounds pass through different resonant paths
facts.value: In order to play a melody, a musician closes and opens apertures on balaban using his fingertips. Thus, a sound coming out of the mouthpiece creates a melody, passing through different resonant paths.

facts.name: The pitch of the mouthpiece can be adjusted
facts.value: A mouthpiece made of reed is put on the head of the body. The instrument’s sound pitch is regulated by a clamp on the mouthpiece.

facts.name: The mouthpiece is also called a 'sound stimulant'
facts.value: The mouthpiece is also called a 'sound stimulant'. In fact, a mouthpiece may produce a sound without balaban’s body.

facts.name: Balaban means 'little, early cock sound'
facts.value: The name of this instrument is stemming from the words bala (little) and ban (cock’s sound) and corresponds to the meaning of 'little, early cock sound'.
